author: deme1744
content:
<@!364458974906548225> What is the purpose of the ENR database in your feature list: https://notes.ethereum.org/8LbisMwtR4yK64SBosb_2g#C---ENR-Database ? 
Is it about storing (useful) ENRs to quickly connect to peers when the node gets started or restarted? And thus also avoid relying solely on bootstrap nodes.
Or rather about having some sort of additional "cache" of useful peers aside from the routing table (although I'm not sure of why that would be needed right now).

author: pipermerriam
content: Does your routing table store the full enr? Or just nodeid?

author: pipermerriam
content: Kk, then you probably don't need that functionality.

author: deme1744
content: Ah, so you meant it as a lookup database of nodeid to ENR mapping?

author: pipermerriam
content: In the python prototypes, routing table was nodeid only. So the database was used to look up endpoint information

author: pipermerriam
content: Yes, to look up ip address and port

author: deme1744
content:
OK, cool. Thanks for clarifying that. 
An ENR (persistent) database  will still be useful for us to bootstrap from after restart.
